items.message:
River levels downstream on the River Yeo, and on the Rivers Cam and Wriggle, have fallen but the level remains high at Sherborne Lake, which is still above the Alert level. Moderate rain today, Sunday 07/12/2025, will likely keep this level high. Other rivers in the area, including the Rivers Yeo, Cam and Wriggle, may rise but they are not currently forecast to reach Alert level. Standing water may occur on low lying land and roads. 
A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from Monday evening through to about midday on Tuesday, which will cause further flooding impacts. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers are still high, sustained by the high flows coming down the catchments following the recent rains. The River Yeo level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.45m and falling slowly. The drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.06m and falling slowly. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We are unable to pump while the River Yeo is full. Moderate rain today, Sunday 07/12/2025, may bring flows from upstream and sustain the higher levels. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from Monday evening through to about midday on Tuesday, which will cause further flooding impacts. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We will resume pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain higher than normal in Hellingly and Alfriston, but are falling following Friday's rain. Minor flood impacts affecting fields could continue through Sunday. Light rain is forecast for much of Sunday 07/12/2025. A small river rise is probable Sunday afternoon. Water levels will not rise as high as they were on Saturday, and should begin to fall by the early hours of Monday. Less rain is forecast Monday. River levels should return nearer to normal by Monday evening. However another band of rain in the early hours of Tuesday will likely increase flood risk again. We are closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood (Mill Lane and Church Road Hellingly, North Street Alfriston). This message will be updated by 12:00 on 08/12/2025.

River levels are still rising in Fittleworth, following Friday's rain. Minor flood impacts affecting fields and gardens near Fittleworth Mill will continue through Sunday and Monday. At Lodsbridge near Selham, the river is higher than normal, but slowly falling. Between Liss and Midhurst, river levels have already fallen nearer to a normal level. Light rain is forecast for much of Sunday 07/12/2025. A small river rise is probable in all communities Sunday afternoon, but in all locations other than Fittleworth, river levels will not rise as high as they were on Saturday, and should begin to fall by the early hours of Monday. In Fittleworth, river levels could continue rising until 18:00 on 07/12/2025 and any fall in water level will be slow. Another band of rain in the early hours of Tuesday will likely increase flood risk again. We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have, including in Lodsbridge and Fittleworth. This message will be updated by 12:00 on 08/12/2025.

River levels in Barcombe are now slowly falling, following Friday's rain. River levels upstream, between Ardingly and Sharpsbridge have already fallen significantly. Minor impact flooding affecting fields, particularly near Barcombe Mills, could continue through Sunday. Light rain is forecast for much of Sunday 07/12/2025. River levels are not expected to rise significantly and should remain lower than Saturday. It is possible river levels could continue to fall despite the light rain. Less rain is forecast Monday. River levels should return nearer to normal by Monday evening. However another band of rain in the early hours of Tuesday will likely increase flood risk again. We are closely monitoring the situation and operating structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to reduce flood risk. 
Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood, including Barcombe Mills Road. This message will be updated by 12:00 on 08/12/2025.

items.message:
High tides on Sunday evening and Monday morning may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 11:15pm on Sunday evening and 11:30am on Monday morning.

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Estuary from Sandhurst to Chepstow and Sharpness over the coming days. Some lengths of the flood embankment at Longney and The Noards may be overtopped. Rodley Lane, Westbury and Awre Road, Brims Pill may be flooded. 

Predicted peaks: - 
Sunday evening 07/12; Gloucester 3.5m to 3.6m at 23:15PM, Sandhurst 3.7m to 3.9m at 23:30PM. 
Monday morning 08/12; Gloucester 3.5m to 3.6m at 11:30AM, Sandhurst 3.7m to 3.9m at 11:45AM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Please continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 

This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today have led to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 07 December 2025 .  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Peaks:- Hay on Wye 2.36m at 20:30 06/12, Bredwardine 4.39m at 00:00 07/12, Belmont 4.50m at 05:00 07/12, Old Wye Bridge 3.90 at 04:45 07/12, Mordiford 4.3m to 4.4m on 07/12 AM, Ross on Wye 3.6m to 3.9m on 07/12 PM. . The River Tone at Currymoor Pumping Station is still high. It is fluctuating marginally above and below the Alert level (Hookbridge Spillway) due to the high tide sequence and flows from recent rain. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is 7.41m and falling slightly. Water enters Currymoor via Hookbridge spillway if this level exceeds 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 4.99m and rising slowly. Cutts Road floods if this level is above 5.75m, and New Road floods if it is above 6.18m. We are unable to pump while the Tone is full. Moderate rain today, Sunday 07/12/2025, may bring flows from upstream and keep the Tone at Alert level. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from Monday evening through to about midday on Tuesday, which will cause further impacts. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We will resume pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Tuesday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Tuesday's morning tide at 01:30 on 09/12/2025 and 03:33 on 09/12/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. Total forecast tide is 3.77 metres Chart Datum (1.79 mAOD) at Lymington. Strong Southerly Force 6 wind. The tide will be highest at the time of second high water. Small amounts of water will flood the footpath near the Ship Inn pub at Town Quay. Saltgrass Lane will flood and be completely impassable to traffic. Property flooding is not expected. Tuesday's tide at 13:34 on 09/12/2025 is forecast to be 4 cm higher (1.83 mAOD). We are closing flood gates. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Please note that flood gates will also be closed for the afternoon tide on 08/12/2025. This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 08/12/2025.

items.description: South Hayling and South Eastoke seafront
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding overnight. 
Flooding is expected for 2 hours either side of Monday's early morning tide at 01:12 on 08/12/2025.   
The weather increases tide table values by 0.18 m. The total forecast tide is 4.98 metres Chart Datum (2.25 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light South Westerly Force 3 wind. It is possible there will be water in the prom at high tide in the Eastoke Corner area. Local teams are monitoring the beach condition at Eastoke for any further actions. Monday's tide at 13:21 on 08/12/2025 is forecast to be 1 cm lower (2.24 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . Avoid South Hayling seafront. Shingle can be thrown by wind and waves. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message: Levels remain high on the River Yeo following the recent rain. While levels have dropped further up in the Pen Mill and Ilchester areas, river and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Long Load and Huish Episcopi. Therefore the need for this Alert remains. Floodwater will remain in lowland areas, such as around Long Load, Wet Moor and Huish Episcopi. Moderate rain today, Sunday 07/12/2025, may bring some extra flows from the upper catchments and sustain the higher levels in the moors. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from Monday evening through to about midday on Tuesday, which will cause further flooding impacts. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following the recent heavy rain. While levels have dropped further up at Pen Mill and Chiselborough, river and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. Therefore the need for this Alert remains. Flooding is possible near the River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy, with low lying land and roads likely to be most affected, possibly at Westover Trading Estate at Langport. Moderate rain today, Sunday 07/12/2025, may bring flows from upstream and sustain the higher levels in the Moors. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from Monday evening through to about midday on Tuesday, which will cause further flooding impacts. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already.
